nukebridge.executors.core package

nukebridge.executors.core.baseexecutor module

class nukebridge.executors.core.baseexecutor.BaseExecutor[source]

Bases: object

property frame_range
static frame_range_type(frame_range)[source]
processes_parser()[source]

This method processes the arguments. It parses the arguments and stores them in a dictionary.

remove_argument(arg_name)[source]

Removes an argument from the argparse.ArgumentParser instance.

Args:

arg_name: The name of the argument to remove. Automatically adds ‘–’ prefix if not present.

run()[source]

This method is intended to be updated by the user to handle the data processing logic. The user should implement the actual data processing logic here.

In this current implementation, it reads the image, logs the arguments and the input, and prints a message indicating that the run is complete.

Returns:

The result of the data processing.

setup_parser()[source]

This method sets up the argument parser. It adds arguments for the cache directory, output path, input path, frame range, logger level, and data.

nukebridge.executors.core.baseliveexecutor module

class nukebridge.executors.core.baseliveexecutor.BaseLiveExecutor[source]

Bases: BaseExecutor

live_run(*args, **kwargs)[source]

This function is intended to be updated by the user to handle the data sent from the node. The user should implement the actual data processing logic here. The returned value from this function will get passed back to the node.

In this current implementation, it simply logs the arguments to demonstrate how it works.

Args:

*args: Variable length argument list. **kwargs: Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Returns:

The result of the data processing which will be passed back to the node.

setup_parser()[source]

This method sets up the argument parser. It adds an argument for the server port. :return:
